args: No! It cannot end like this!
Come at me with greater intent to kill,\nor you will know only destruction!
As today is the final day of our vacation,\nlet's each spend our time freely.
I'm going to pick out some souvenirs for\nRanmaru and the others. Come, Mitsuhide.
Noooo! I was just gonna slob around\nand sleep in my rooooom!
Lord Seimei, I hear there's a sorcerer in a\nnearby town what uses interestin' magic.
Could be useful for my onmyodo research.\nLet's check it out.
How about spending some time\nwith a childhood friend?
Botan! I know I wrote you to say I would\nbe coming here, but aren't you supposed\nto be at the Halidom?
I asked {player_name} to let her\njoin us.
I had to finish some stuff up first, though,\nso I only just got here today.
I know you haven't had a chance to see her\nsince the trouble with Tsukuyomi, so I\nhope you can enjoy some time together.
I am grateful to you for your care\nand concern, Shingen.
The Wyrmclan leaders enjoy the last day of the\ntrip doing as they please. However...
That was a fine bath, Fudo Myo-o. ...Hmm?
So that's your answer, huh? Fine.

And hey, I get it—but I'm SERIOUSLY
disappointed. Why do you think I've been
working my tail off this whole time, huh?
It was so I could stand as your equal!
It would be best not to follow. I don't know\nexactly what happened, but interference\nwould likely make the situation worse.

I promise we weren't trying to eavesdrop—
we just sort of stumbled into all of this.
But now that we have, perhaps you might
explain the situation?
Botan chose to hone her skills at the\nHalidom for my sake.
Then I can return home to serve my\nmaster and future shogun.
A very promising decision, Botan.\nI shall await your return.
A moment ago, I received an offer from\nher: She wishes to end her training and\nwork as a vassal of the Boar Wyrmclan.
I've heard much about Botan's value to\nthose at the Halidom; she is by all\naccounts a mightily talented woman.
Indeed. But I faltered and could not\nrespond immediately, so then...
Surely Botan is strong enough for this\ntask? I shouldn't think you would have\nreason to hesitate at all.
I have to this point treated Botan as a\nfriend and companion—one I can always\nbe myself around.
However, if she became a vassal,\nour relationship could not continue\nin this manner.
Aside from Addis and Sazanka—who are\nclose friends with her—it would seem like\nunfair treatment to the others.
So you weighed the way you would have to\ntreat her against the relationship you have.
I do not mean to make light of Botan's\nfeelings; it is the height of shame that\nI hesitated in my answer.
So while you had planned for this very\nthing, your heart was still not ready\nfor it.
I might be an even more spineless man\nthan I thought.
I would say awkward, not spineless.\nYour honesty is one of your virtues,\nbut one which also clouds your heart.
Which is why I challenge you to\na sumo match!
At times like these, there is nothing better\nfor clearing the mind than a little exercise.\nDon't you agree, Fudo Myo-o?
Indeed. Let yourself be refreshed by\ncompeting with a man of superior skill\nin the form of Lord Shingen.
How can I say no to such an offer?
The match is still on! Continue!
As immovable as the mountains, friend!
By the way, Ieyasu. It is the way of things\nthat we Wyrmclan leaders have shortened\nlives due to our soulpacts.
But when death finally draws near to you...\nwhat will YOU do?!
Did Fudo Myo-o erect a barrier?!

This has been transformed into an
inescapable wrestling ring of death.
Now come, Ieyasu. Show me what you
are truly made of!

We are enemies competing for the seat of
shogun—and I suggested this trip to give
you all pleasant memories as I usher you
into the underworld!
You would lay me low here, Shingen?\nDo not speak such foolishness!
You think I speak in jest? Best think again!
(I believe he truly intends to kill me!)

Have you soiled yourself out of fear?
Are you frozen to that spot? Be warned,
if you do not come at me, then I will have
to come at you! HAAAAAAH!
No! It cannot end like this!
Come at me with greater intent to kill,\nor you will know only destruction!
I'm caught between Shingen and the\nbarrier! ...Gah! Aaaaaargh!
And for my finishing move, I will crush you\nlike a ripe melon. Know then that your\npride has invited this outcome!
You have accepted the constraints of your\nshortened life and are attempting to live\nwithout regrets.

But does an expectation not linger in your
heart? A belief that perhaps your life
might NOT be shortened? That you might
escape the bargain of the soulpact?
Or perhaps you're hoping to find a way to\nnullify it? However you claim it, I don't\nthink you're prepared to face death.

Somewhere in your heart, you hope your
life continues. This is why you cannot
make decisions quickly, and why you
suffer an embarrassing defeat today.
(I thought I would not regret my life\nas a virtuous warrior...)
(But I was blessed with good friends and\nvassals, and sometimes dream that my\nhappiness can last forever...)
(My wish to continue living may have\ntransformed into a delusion that I truly\ncan live longer.)
Reality is cruel, and the lifespan of those\nwith a soulpact is short...but you are\ndestined to die here and now! Haaaah!
(Struggle as I may, I cannot live longer\nthan regular people. Nonetheless, I...)
I have something I desire! HRAAAAAH!
*pant* *pant* My finishing move...\nis the overarm throw.
Clumsy, but determined. It suits you.\nDon't you agree, Ieyasu?
Shingen! Was this some sort of trick\nyou set up to spur me on?!
It matters not. Now that you have peered\ninto the abyss of death, has anything\nwithin you changed?
Yes. Thanks to you. I hesitate no longer.
Then you should go to your old friend\nand tell her what is in your heart.

Your hesitation was caused by your
desire to treat her as special.
There should be more than one possible
answer here...
You were good as well, Fudo Myo-o.\n*cough* *hack*
Ugh. I need to drink my... Blast!\nWhere has it gone?!
Somebody left this medicine bag in the\nchanging room. One of the hot spring\nemployees found it.
